instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820 2523b no backlight
threads.message:
f9800 12.6V
<RESISTOR>R9808</RESISTOR> pin1 12.61 pin2 12.24
<RESISTOR>R9802</RESISTOR> pin1 12.61  pin 2 12.24
<RESISTOR>R9809</RESISTOR> pin 1 12.07  pin2 12.61

<TRANSISTOR>Q9806</TRANSISTOR> Pin 1=0V
pin2=0V
pin3=12.24
pin4=12.6
pin5=0V
pin6=0v

L9701=0V pin 1 and 2
<CHIP>U9701</CHIP> pin23=0V

threads.title: 820 2523b no backlight
threads.message:
random measurements?

does it chime,?
have you got fan spin?
liquid damage?

known good screen and kabel?
can you see apple logo when putting a light on the back of the screen?

threads.title: 820 2523b no backlight
threads.message:
I am not sure what you mean when you say "random measurements"
It does chime
No fan spin when board is out of casing, unsure if it spins when in case
No liquid damage
Yes good screen and cable
Yes I see apple logo

threads.title: 820 2523b no backlight
threads.message: Uhm, does this board even chime and produce an image? Check with flashlight.

threads.title: 820 2523b no backlight
threads.message: I do get chime and image.

threads.title: 820 2523b no backlight
threads.message: Check pin 2 and 5 of <TRANSISTOR>Q9807</TRANSISTOR> again. I don't believe both of them are low. Screen needs to be connected of course!

threads.title: 820 2523b no backlight
threads.message:
just the screen and the magsafe plugged in I get 0V on both pin 2 and 5 of <TRANSISTOR>Q9807</TRANSISTOR>
I am using a schematic that says 850-2523 not 850-2523b if this is my issue

threads.title: 820 2523b no backlight
threads.message: Resistance to GND on pin 2 and 5 of <TRANSISTOR>Q9807</TRANSISTOR>?

threads.title: 820 2523b no backlight
threads.message:
4.7 kilohm on pin 5 of <TRANSISTOR>Q9807</TRANSISTOR> in diode mode
1.35 milliohm on pin 2 of <TRANSISTOR>Q9807</TRANSISTOR> in diode mode
0.44V on pin 5 of <TRANSISTOR>Q8907</TRANSISTOR> in resistance mode
0.43V on pin 2 of <TRANSISTOR>Q9807</TRANSISTOR> in resistance mode

threads.title: 820 2523b no backlight
threads.message: Those measurements make no sense. Please learn how to use a multimeter.
